alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 20 at 6:41PM HST until December 20 at 8:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF KAUAI IN KAUAI COUNTY... At 641 PM HST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain was decreasing across the northeast two-thirds of Kauai. However, The Hanalei River remains elevated and the Kuhio Highway across it remains closed. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lihue, Kapaa, Kalaheo, Princeville, Kilauea, North Fork Wailua Trails, Wailua Homesteads, Alakai Swamp Trails, Hanalei, Omao, Lawai, Wailua, Wainiha, Koloa, Kokee State Park, Haena, Na Pali State Park, Hanapepe, Poipu and Anahola. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. The heavy rains may cause rock and mudslides in steep terrain areas.
